articles.description: English translations of full moon names date back a few hundred years to Native Americans living in what is now the northern and eastern United States. Names differed as per tribe customs and had significance.
articles.content:
• Most native American tribes reckoned 12 moons to a year. Some northern tribes, notably those of New England, and the Cree tribes, counted 13.
